A gap is an area where no trades took place, leaving no support or resistance behind, making it "easier" for price to traverse and fill the gap.  $BTC CME gaps don't matter as much as most volume takes place outside the CME in 24/7 exchanges => CME gaps are not "real" gaps.

Common misconceptions about Bitcoin and energy - transactions are not necessarily single payments - energy use does not scale with number of tx - miners do not "waste" energy in remote locations where it would otherwise go unused - only miners on cheapest energy survive long term
